summary.span: 提供字节序列的一般视图。

span.span: Provides a generic view of a sequence of bytes.

summary.span: 这是一个抽象类。

span.span: This is an abstract class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是所有流的抽象基类。 is the abstract base class of all streams. 流是字节序列的抽象，例如文件、输入/输出设备、进程中通信管道或 TCP/IP 套接字。A stream is an abstraction of a sequence of bytes, such as a file, an input/output device, an inter-process communication pipe, or a TCP/IP socket. 类和其派生的类提供的输入和输出，这些不同类型的一般视图，并使程序员不必了解操作系统和基础设备的具体细节。The class and its derived classes provide a generic view of these different types of input and output, and isolate the programmer from the specific details of the operating system and the underlying devices. 流涉及三个基本操作：Streams involve three fundamental operations: - 您可以从流中读取。You can read from streams. 读取是将数据从一个流传送到数据结构，如字节数组。Reading is the transfer of data from a stream into a data structure, such as an array of bytes. - 可以写入流。You can write to streams. 写作是数据的数据结构传输到流。Writing is the transfer of data from a data structure into a stream. - 流可以支持查找。Streams can support seeking. 查找引用查询和修改流中的当前位置。Seeking refers to querying and modifying the current position within a stream. 查找功能取决于流有的后备存储的类型。Seek capability depends on the kind of backing store a stream has. 例如，网络流的当前位置，没有统一概念，并且因此通常不支持搜寻。For example, network streams have no unified concept of a current position, and therefore typically do not support seeking. 一些较常用的流的继承都，和。Some of the more commonly used streams that inherit from are , and . 根据基础数据源或存储库，流可能支持仅某些功能。Depending on the underlying data source or repository, streams might support only some of these capabilities. 可以通过使用查询流的功能， ，并的属性类。You can query a stream for its capabilities by using the , , and properties of the class. 和方法读取和写入不同的格式的数据。The and methods read and write data in a variety of formats. 对于支持查找的流，使用并方法并和属性，以查询和修改的当前位置和流的长度。For streams that support seeking, use the and methods and the and properties to query and modify the current position and length of a stream. 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `catch`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"使用对象实现 IDisposable"一节接口主题。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 释放对象会刷新所有缓冲的数据，并实质上是调用为您的方法。Disposing a object flushes any buffered data, and essentially calls the method for you. 也会释放操作系统资源，例如文件句柄、 网络连接或用于任何内部缓冲的内存。 also releases operating system resources such as file handles, network connections, or memory used for any internal buffering. 类提供的另一个流以便提高读取和写入性能周围包装缓冲的流的功能。The class provides the capability of wrapping a buffered stream around another stream in order to improve read and write performance. 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]，则类包括异步方法来简化异步操作。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)], the class includes async methods to simplify asynchronous operations. 异步方法包含`Async`中其名称，如， ， ，和。An async method contains `Async` in its name, such as , , , and . 这些方法，可执行占用大量资源的 I/O 操作而不会阻止主线程。These methods enable you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 结合使用异步方法`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的关键字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 在中使用时[!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)]应用程序中，包括两个扩展方法：和。When used in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app, includes two extension methods: and . 这些方法将转换向流中的对象[!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)]。These methods convert a object to a stream in the [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)]. 此外可以将转换中的流[!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)]到通过使用对象和方法。You can also convert a stream in the [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/includes/wrt-md.md)] to a object by using the and methods. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：在 .NET Framework 流和 Windows 运行时流之间进行转换](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-convert-between-dotnet-streams-and-winrt-streams.md)For more information, see [How to: Convert Between .NET Framework Streams and Windows Runtime Streams](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-convert-between-dotnet-streams-and-winrt-streams.md) 某些流实现执行本地缓冲的基础数据以提高性能。Some stream implementations perform local buffering of the underlying data to improve performance. 对于此类流，你可以使用或方法以清除所有内部缓冲区并确保所有数据，已都写入到基础数据源或存储库。For such streams, you can use the or method to clear any internal buffers and ensure that all data has been written to the underlying data source or repository. 如果你需要具有无后备存储 （也称为位存储桶） 的流，使用检索为此目的设计的流的实例字段。If you need a stream with no backing store (also known as a bit bucket), use the field to retrieve an instance of a stream that is designed for this purpose. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用两个对象以异步方式将文件从一个目录复制到另一个目录。The following example demonstrates how to use two objects to asynchronously copy the files from one directory to another directory. 类是从 类派生的。The class derives from the class. 需要注意 控件的 事件处理程序具有 `async` 修饰符标记，因为它调用异步方法。Notice that the event handler for the control is marked with the `async` modifier because it calls an asynchronous method. [!code-csharp[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/vb/example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 .NET Framework 4 和更早的版本中，您必须使用 和 之类的方法来实现异步 I/O 操作。In the .NET Framework 4 and earlier versions, you have to use methods such as and to implement asynchronous I/O operations. 这些方法是在中仍然可用[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]以支持旧版代码; 但是，新的异步方法，如， ， ，和，帮助您更轻松地实现异步 I/O 操作。These methods are still available in the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] to support legacy code; however, the new async methods, such as , , , and , help you implement asynchronous I/O operations more easily. 默认实现`BeginRead`流调用方法以同步方式，这意味着，`Read`可能会阻止某些流。The default implementation of `BeginRead` on a stream calls the method synchronously, which means that `Read` might block on some streams. 但是，实例的类，如`FileStream`和`NetworkStream`完全支持异步操作，如果实例已异步打开。However, instances of classes such as `FileStream` and `NetworkStream` fully support asynchronous operations if the instances have been opened asynchronously. 因此，调用`BeginRead`不会阻止对这些流。Therefore, calls to `BeginRead` will not block on those streams. 您可以重写`BeginRead`（通过使用异步委托，例如） 提供异步行为。You can override `BeginRead` (by using async delegates, for example) to provide asynchronous behavior. 传递`IAsyncResult`返回值为方法以确定已读取的字节数并释放操作系统资源用于进行读取的流。Pass the `IAsyncResult` return value to the method of the stream to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 必须为每个调用一次调用。 must be called once for every call to . 您可以执行此操作是通过调用的相同代码`BeginRead`或在传递给回调`BeginRead`。You can do this either by using the same code that called `BeginRead` or in a callback passed to `BeginRead`. 当异步读取或写入发出时，I/O 操作完成时不会更新中流的当前位置。The current position in the stream is updated when the asynchronous read or write is issued, not when the I/O operation completes. 多个同时进行的异步请求呈现请求完成顺序不确定。Multiple simultaneous asynchronous requests render the request completion order uncertain. 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持读取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 如果流已关闭或传递了无效的参数，将立即引发异常从`BeginRead`。If a stream is closed or you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately from `BeginRead`. 异步读取请求，例如，I/O 请求过程的磁盘故障过程中发生的错误发生在线程池线程和调用时引发异常`EndRead`。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request, such as a disk failure during the I/O request, occur on the thread pool thread and throw exceptions when calling `EndRead`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 .NET Framework 4 和更早的版本中，您必须使用 和 之类的方法来实现异步 I/O 操作。In the .NET Framework 4 and earlier versions, you have to use methods such as and to implement asynchronous I/O operations. 这些方法是在中仍然可用[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)]以支持旧版代码; 但是，新的异步方法，如， ， ，和，帮助您更轻松地实现异步 I/O 操作。These methods are still available in the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] to support legacy code; however, the new async methods, such as , , , and , help you implement asynchronous I/O operations more easily. 默认实现`BeginWrite`流调用方法以同步方式，这意味着，`Write`可能会阻止某些流。The default implementation of `BeginWrite` on a stream calls the method synchronously, which means that `Write` might block on some streams. 但是，实例的类，如`FileStream`和`NetworkStream`完全支持异步操作，如果实例已异步打开。However, instances of classes such as `FileStream` and `NetworkStream` fully support asynchronous operations if the instances have been opened asynchronously. 因此，调用`BeginWrite`不会阻止对这些流。Therefore, calls to `BeginWrite` will not block on those streams. 您可以重写`BeginWrite`（通过使用异步委托，例如） 提供异步行为。You can override `BeginWrite` (by using async delegates, for example) to provide asynchronous behavior. 传递`IAsyncResult`返回到当前方法的以确保写入完成，并相应地释放资源。Pass the `IAsyncResult` returned by the current method to to ensure that the write completes and frees resources appropriately. 必须为每个调用一次调用。 must be called once for every call to . 您可以执行此操作是通过调用的相同代码`BeginWrite`或在传递给回调`BeginWrite`。You can do this either by using the same code that called `BeginWrite` or in a callback passed to `BeginWrite`. 如果异步写入过程中发生错误，将不会引发异常之前`EndWrite`与名为`IAsyncResult`此方法返回。If an error occurs during an asynchronous write, an exception will not be thrown until `EndWrite` is called with the `IAsyncResult` returned by this method. 如果流是可写，写入流的末尾将扩展该流。If a stream is writable, writing at the end of the stream expands the stream. 在 I/O 操作完成时不发出异步读取或写入，时更新中流的当前位置。The current position in the stream is updated when you issue the asynchronous read or write, not when the I/O operation completes. 多个同时进行的异步请求呈现请求完成顺序不确定。Multiple simultaneous asynchronous requests render the request completion order uncertain. 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 如果流已关闭或传递了无效的参数，将立即引发异常从`BeginWrite`。If a stream is closed or you pass an invalid argument, exceptions are thrown immediately from `BeginWrite`. 异步写入请求，例如，I/O 请求过程的磁盘故障过程中发生的错误发生在线程池线程和调用时引发异常`EndWrite`。Errors that occur during an asynchronous write request, such as a disk failure during the I/O request, occur on the thread pool thread and throw exceptions when calling `EndWrite`.

span.span: Instead of calling this method, ensure that the stream is properly disposed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法调用，并指定`true`释放所有资源。This method calls , specifying `true` to release all resources. 不需要明确调用方法。You do not have to specifically call the method. 相反，确保每个正确释放对象。Instead, ensure that every object is properly disposed. 您可以声明中的对象`using`块 (或`Using`阻止在 Visual Basic 中) 以确保释放的流和它的所有资源，或者可以显式调用方法。You can declare objects within a `using` block (or `Using` block in Visual Basic) to ensure that the stream and all of its resources are disposed, or you can explicitly call the method. 如果不显式调用的实现，刷新该流不会刷新其基础编码器或`Close`。Flushing the stream will not flush its underlying encoder unless you explicitly call an implementation of or `Close`. 设置到`true`意味着数据从缓冲区刷新到流中，但编码器状态不会进行刷新。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 这将允许编码器，以便它可以正确编码的字符的下一步块保持其状态 （部分字符）。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. 这种情况下会影响 UTF8，UTF7 其中某些字符可以仅后在编码器收到的相邻字符编码。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can be encoded only after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters. 尝试操作流后关闭流可能会引发。Attempts to manipulate the stream after the stream has been closed might throw an .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使您能够执行占用大量资源的 I/O 操作而不会阻止主线程。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 结合使用异步方法`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的关键字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 在当前流中的当前位置开始复制。Copying begins at the current position in the current stream. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用两个要以异步方式将文件从一个目录复制到另一个对象。The following example demonstrates how to use two objects to asynchronously copy the files from one directory to another. 类是从 类派生的。The class derives from the class. 请注意，事件处理程序控件将标有`async`修饰符因为它调用异步方法Notice that the event handler for the control is marked with the `async` modifier because it calls an asynchronous method [!code-csharp[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/cs/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/vb/example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 你应通过指定释放所有资源`true`为`disposing`。You should release all resources by specifying `true` for `disposing`. 当`disposing`是`true`，流还可以确保数据刷新到基础缓冲区，并访问其他可终结的对象。When `disposing` is `true`, the stream can also ensure data is flushed to the underlying buffer, and access other finalizable objects. 这不是在从由于缺乏终结器之间的排序，终结器调用时。This may not be possible when called from a finalizer due a lack of ordering among finalizers. 如果你的流使用操作系统句柄来与其源进行通信，请考虑使用的子类实现此目的。If your stream is using an operating system handle to communicate with its source, consider using a subclass of for this purpose. 调用此方法由公共方法和方法。This method is called by the public method and the method. 调用受保护方法替换`disposing`参数设置为`true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用与`disposing`设置为`false`。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`.

para.span: 在派生类中，不会重写方法，而是将所有中的 Stream 清理逻辑方法。

span.span: In derived classes, do not override the method, instead, put all of the Stream cleanup logic in the method.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写 时，请注意不要引用在以前调用 时已释放的对象。

span.span: When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使您能够在不阻塞主线程的情况下执行占用大量资源的释放操作。The method enables you to perform a resource-intensive dispose operation without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 结合使用异步方法`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的关键字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 此方法通过写入后备存储的任何更改并关闭流，以释放资源释放流。This method disposes the stream by writing any changes to the backing store and closing the stream to release resources. 调用`DisposeAsync`允许使用的资源重新分配用于其他目的。Calling `DisposeAsync` allows the resources used by the to be reallocated for other purposes. 有关详细信息，请参阅[清理了非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，将清除该流的所有缓冲区，并使得所有缓冲数据被写入到基础设备。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 重写`Flush`上实现一个缓冲区的流。Override `Flush` on streams that implement a buffer. 使用此方法将任何信息从基础缓冲区移动到其目标，请清除缓冲区，或两者。Use this method to move any information from an underlying buffer to its destination, clear the buffer, or both. 根据对象的状态，可能需要修改流中的当前位置 （例如，如果基础流支持查找）。Depending upon the state of the object, you might have to modify the current position within the stream (for example, if the underlying stream supports seeking). 有关其他信息，请参见 。For additional information see . 在派生类中，不支持写入，通常作为空方法，以确保完全兼容与其他实现类型由于它是有效刷新只读流。In a class derived from that doesn't support writing, is typically implemented as an empty method to ensure full compatibility with other types since it's valid to flush a read-only stream. 使用时或类中，不会刷新基对象。When using the or class, do not flush the base object. 而是使用类的或方法，可确保数据是第一次刷新到基础流，然后写入到文件。Instead, use the class's or method, which makes sure that the data is flushed to the underlying stream first and then written to the file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持读取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 使用方法从当前流异步读取。Use the method to read asynchronously from the current stream. 此方法的实现读取的最多`buffer.Length`个字节从当前流，并将其在存储`buffer`。Implementations of this method read a maximum of `buffer.Length` bytes from the current stream and store them in `buffer`. 在流中的当前位置高级通过读取; 的字节数但是，如果发生异常，该流中的当前位置保持不变。The current position within the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read; however, if an exception occurs, the current position within the stream remains unchanged. 实现返回读取的字节数。Implementations return the number of bytes read. 实现将阻止直到至少一个字节的数据可供读取，在没有数据是可用的事件。The implementation will block until at least one byte of data can be read, in the event that no data is available. 仅在流中没有更多的数据且不再需要 （如套接字已关闭或文件结尾） 时将返回 0。 returns 0 only when there is no more data in the stream and no more is expected (such as a closed socket or end of file). 实现可以自由地返回少于所请求的字节，即使尚未达到流结尾。An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. 使用读取基元数据类型。Use for reading primitive data types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使您能够执行占用大量资源的 I/O 操作而不会阻止主线程。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 结合使用异步方法`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的关键字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持读取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 如果在完成之前，将取消该操作，则返回的任务将包含值属性。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property. 有关示例，请参阅重载。For an example, see the overload.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持查找。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports seeking. 如果`offset`为负，则新位置需要前加上指定的位置`origin`按指定的字节数`offset`。If `offset` is negative, the new position is required to precede the position specified by `origin` by the number of bytes specified by `offset`. 如果`offset`是零 (0)，则新位置是需要将指定的位置`origin`。If `offset` is zero (0), the new position is required to be the position specified by `origin`. 如果`offset`为正，则新位置是需要由指定的位置之后`origin`按指定的字节数`offset`。If `offset` is positive, the new position is required to follow the position specified by `origin` by the number of bytes specified by `offset`. 类派生自`Stream`支持查找必须重写此方法以提供上文所述的功能。Classes derived from `Stream` that support seeking must override this method to provide the functionality described above. 支持查找到流的长度超出任何位置。Seeking to any location beyond the length of the stream is supported.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法使您能够执行占用大量资源的 I/O 操作而不会阻止主线程。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 结合使用异步方法`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的关键字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用属性来确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何以异步方式写入文件。The following example shows how to write asynchronously to a file. 该示例使用类，该类派生自类。The example uses the class, which derives from the class.
